meanings.sent1: The puppy was the liveliest in the litter, always bouncing around.
meanings.sent2: The children played with the liveliest toys in the room.
meanings.sent3: The liveliest squirrel in the park kept stealing nuts from the others.
meanings.sent4: Her liveliest imagination led her to create colorful worlds in her stories.
meanings.sent5: The liveliest flowers in the garden danced in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Showing a lot of interest and enthusiasm
meanings.sent1: She was the liveliest student in the class, always eager to participate.
meanings.sent2: The audience clapped the liveliest for the talented performers.
meanings.sent3: The liveliest fan at the concert knew all the lyrics by heart.
meanings.sent4: His liveliest smile brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The liveliest explorer in the group was ready for any adventure.

meanings.definition: In a way that is full of activity and excitement
meanings.sent1: The children played liveliest when the sun was shining.
meanings.sent2: The market was liveliest on weekends, bustling with shoppers.
meanings.sent3: The party became liveliest when the music started playing.
meanings.sent4: The town square was liveliest during the annual festival.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was liveliest during group projects.
